title: Apple rings the changes with a tiny touchscreen
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Apple rings the changes with a tiny touchscreen The patent application shows how the ring would be operated James Dean Technology Correspondent Published 1 minute ago 
A “smart” ring that detects handwriting and transmits it to a computer screen is being developed by Apple. 
The tiny computer, quickly dubbed the iRing, could also be used to compose text messages by writing in the air. 
It would feature a pressure-sensitive screen and microphone to allow touch and voice commands, according to a patent application published by the US Patent and Trademark Office. 
Apple says in the application that touchpads and touchscreen displays can be unwieldy for certain tasks, so slicker, more discreet, ways of controlling them are needed. 
It says that the ring would detect hand gestures Subscribe now
